author: Yahoo Celebrity UK
title: Ricki Lake in mourning after ex-husband Christian Evans dies aged 45
text:
US talk show host Ricki Lake has revealed that her former husband, Christian Evans, has died aged 45 after a lifelong battle with bipolar disorder.
View photos
Ricki Lake revealed that her ex husband had died (Copyright: Getty/Amanda Edwards) More The 48-year-old actress, who rose to fame in 1988’s original ‘Hairspray’ film, shared that tragic news on Instagram, posting a sweet photo of the pair embracing alongside a touching caption.
Quote: : “It is with a heavy heart that I share that my beloved soulmate, Christian Evans has passed. The world didn’t understand this man, but I did. He succumbed to his life long struggle with bipolar disorder.
“For anyone who has ever lost a family member or a friend to mental illness, my heart goes out to you. I am a greater person for having known him and spent the past 6 and a half years of my life with him.”
View photos
The US talk show host shared the heart-breaking news on Instagram (Copyright: Instagram/Ricki Lake) More She added: “He was a man of love and what mends my broken heart today is knowing that he is finally at peace and his spirit is free.”
Ricki concluded her emotional post by saying: “Rest in peace, my love.”
The presenter, who recently appeared as a guest judge on Gary Barlow’s Let It Shine, started dating the jewellery designer in 2010. The two got engaged in the summer of 2011, and eloped in 2012.
View photos
Ricki originally put her divorce on hold due to Christian’s declining health (Copyright: BBC) More “We met through my best friend. He’s a nobody but he’s somebody to me,” she told People magazine at the time. “He’s everything to me… We just clicked. It just feels like he was the right one all along.”
However, shortly after, in 2014, Ricki filed for divorce from Christian, citing irreconcilable differences.
She was previously married to illustrator Rob Sussman. Together they share sons Milo, 19, and Owen, 15.
Our thoughts are with their friends and family at this difficult time.
